data.title: Ernesto Pujol Biography – Ernesto Pujol on artnet
data.meta_description: Read the biography of Ernesto Pujol. Discover interesting facts about Ernesto Pujol on artnet.
data.text:
Timeline

Born in in Havana, Cuba

Presently lives and works in New York

Cintas Foundation, Visual Arts Fellowship, New York

Artist-in-the-Marketplace, Bronx Museum of the Arts, New York

Studio Program, Bronx Council on the Arts, New York

Pollock-Krasner Foundation, Visual Arts Fellowship, New York

Mid-Atlantic Arts Foundation, National Endowment for the Arts Regional Painting Fellowship, Baltimore

Cintas Foundation, Visual Arts Fellowship, New York

The Joan Mitchell Foundation, New York

Pollock-Krasner Foundation, Visual Arts Fellowship, New York

The Cuban Artists’ Fund, New York

Education

1978 Art History Certificate, Universidad Complutence, Madrid

1979 B.A. in Humanities, Fine Arts Major, Magna Cum Laude, Universidad de Puerto Rico, SJ

1980 Theology Certificate, St. John Vianney Seminary, Miami

1984 Graduate work in Education, Universidad Interamericana, San Juan

1985 Silkscreen Seminar, Art Students’ League, San Juan

1987 Graduate work in Art Therapy, Pratt Institute, Brooklyn

1990 Graduate work in Media Theory, Hunter College, New York

Exhibitions

Ernesto Pujol: Walk #1, ARTMATTERS 10, McNay Art Museum, San Antonio, TX (solo)

Ernesto Pujol: Mourning Circle #2, ARTMATTERS 10, McNay Art Museum, San Antonio, TX (solo)

The Promised Land, Galeria Ramis Barquet, New York (solo)

Art Basel Miami Beach, Galeria Ramis Barquet, Miami, FL

ARCO 05, Galeria Ramis Barquet, Madrid, Spain

Reversing Vandalism, San Francisco Public Library, San Francisco, CA

El Futuro es Ahora/The Future is Now, PSCA/Durst Organization, New York

Papeleria, Galeria Comercial, San Juan

Water Table, Spoleto Festival, Charleston

Birspace, Contemporary Art Center, New Orleans, Norton Art Museum, Ft. Lauderdale, The Hudson River Museum, NY

Sharks in the Morning, Daniel Azoulay Gallery, Miami

Whiteness: A Wayward Construction, Laguna Art Museum, Laguna Beach, CA

Silence of Songbirds, Ramis Barquet Gallery, New York (solo)

Becoming the Land, Salina Art Center, Kansas (solo)

Human Fields, Brito Cimino Gallery, Sao Paulo (solo)

American Fields, Jersey City Museum, NJ; Heriard-Cimino Gallery, New Orleans; and Iturralde Gallery, LA (solo)

The Bathers, Priska Juschka Fine Arts, NY (solo)

Family, The Aldrich Museum of Contemporary Art, Ridgefield, CT

Hot City, Daniel Azoulay Gallery, Miami

Peppermint, Smack Mellon, Brooklyn

Daily Life, Rudolph Projects, Houston

Domestic Disturbance, Salina Art Center, Salina, Kansas

El cuerpo de la fe, Galeria Pancho Fierro de la Municipalidad de Lima, Peru (solo)

Ernesto Pujol: Conversion of Manners, Heriard-Cimino Gallery, New Orleans (solo)

Loss of Faith, Ramis Barquet Gallery, NY & Monterrey (solo)

Conversion of Manners, Museo del Barrio, NY, and Allentown Art Museum, PA (solo)

Ernesto Pujol:Whiteness, Gian Carla Zanutti Gallery, Milan (solo)
